New Records: Golden State Warriors defeated Portland Trail Blazers 139-104, setting a new victory margin.
Steph Curry recorded a double-double with 17 points and 10 assists.
Buddy Hield scored 22 points in his debut for the Golden State Warriors.
Key Match Events: Golden State Warriors expanded their lead to 20 points by the fourth quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Portland Trail Blazers struggled with floor balance and communication.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Game was a high-scoring contest with Warriors dominating the second half.
Scoot Henderson scored 22 points off the bench for Portland.
Others: Teams showcased their offensive capabilities early in the season.
